DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Dexmedetomidine Postoperative Analgesia Infantile Cataract Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: In prospective , randomize , control , double blind trial eighty ASA physical status grade I II infant ( 1-12month ) undergo elective cataract surgery one eye general anesthesia study . Infants randomly allocate one two group : subtenon block Group ( SB ) dexmedetomidine ( n =40 ) intravenous dexmedetomidine Group ( IV ) ( n =40 ) . After secure airway , infant Group ( SB ) receive SB block 0.05 mL/kg 0.5 % bupivacaine 0.5µ/kg dexmedetomidine mixture , whereas infant Group ( IV ) receive 1µ/kg IV dexmedetomidine induction anesthesia . Surgery start 5 min study drug administration . Postoperative assessment number infant require rescue analgesia rescue antiemetic primary outcome .
